content:
Songs as sweet as summer brings,
To your flowery lawn should fly
If my verses had the wings—
Wings of birds that haunt the sky. 

Like the spark that upward springs,
They would seek your smiling hearth,
If my verses had the wings—
Wings such as a spirth hath. 

Near you, close as ivy clings,
They would dwell by night and day
If my verses had the wings—
Wings like love to speed the way.
cleaned: songs as sweet as summer brings your flowery lawn should fly if my verses had the wings wings birds that haunt the sky like the spark that upward springs would seek your smiling hearth if my verses had the wings wings such as a spirth hath you close as ivy clings would dwell night and day if my verses had the wings wings like love speed the way
